message: Corrected link to discussion of David P. Robbins prize
Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced must be removed immediately from the article and its talk page

Removed material in previous two edits which cited as source a CRM communique which itself cited no sources but just mentioned the existence of accusations. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons#Remove_contentious_material_that_is_unsourced_or_poorly_sourced
Undid revision 896217364 by [[Special:Contributions/Mozartofprobability|Mozartofprobability]] ([[User talk:Mozartofprobability|talk]])- reason explained in previous revision by CapitalSasha
Replaced "Principal Researcher at [[Microsoft Research]] in Redmond, WA"    by   "mathematician".

removing material sourced from a blog per WP:BLPSPS: "Never use self-published sources—including but not limited to books, zines, websites, blogs, and tweets—as sources of material about a living person" This is material from a comment in Pachter's blog claiming to quote an email message from Peres that is not published on his website or confirmed.

Potentially libelous material removed. From WP:CONTEXTMATTERS: "Sources should directly support the information as it is presented in the Wikipedia article."   However the cited source (CRM) provides no references supporting the claim on allegations of sexual harassment.

Undid revision 905311677 by [[Special:Contributions/Melcous|Melcous]] ([[User talk:Melcous|talk]]) the statement was indeed made in a CRM communique but quoting the unsupported content of the statement violates wikipedia policy WP:BLPGOSSIP and WP:SUSPECT

Removed quotation of a CRM communique that states the existence of accusations without providing any references or evidence (Wikipedia:BLPREMOVE)   "Be wary of relying on sources that use weasel words and that attribute material to anonymous sources. " (WP:BLPGOSSIP)

Undid revision 901613105 by [[Special:Contributions/2600:1700:5450:44F0:84FB:67A3:964F:1D2F|2600:1700:5450:44F0:84FB:67A3:964F:1D2F]] ([[User talk:2600:1700:5450:44F0:84FB:67A3:964F:1D2F|talk]])  BLP issue, Vandalism.

Undid revision 905354390 by [[Special:Contributions/Algebra44|Algebra44]] ([[User talk:Algebra44|talk]]) Cited policy regards self-published sources not by the subject. Email by the subject was sent to a wide group and republished on multiple websites. I don't see a major difference between e-mail and social media posts explicitly sanctioned by WP:BLPSELFPUB WP:SOCIALMEDIA. There is no reason to doubt authenticity.

Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/109.67.252.16|109.67.252.16]] ([[User talk:109.67.252.16|talk]]): Not an appropriate source, nor appropriately written content. Take it to the talk page. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Borelborel|Borelborel]] ([[User talk:Borelborel|talk]]): No reliable source, see [[WP:RS]]. ([[WP:TW|TW]])

removing material sourced from a blog per [[WP:BLPSPS]]: "Never use self-published sources—including but not limited to books, zines, websites, blogs, and tweets—as sources of material about a living person, unless written or published by the subject of the article."
